Bring up the flow properties from the bottom of the screen and find its ID.

Our customer iflow now has all necessary objects to run (the wrapper being a quick set up), we just need to define the global parameters for the Content Modifier we created as a first step in order to have the possibility during execution of the flow to specify what extractor should be read, what mapping should be applied, what filters should be used, etc.

These parameters are already part of the reusable iflow so once we call them in the first step and fill them, they will be automatically read and applied.

To be able to set your own values when executing (deploying) the iflow, you need to externalize them via the Content Modifier step this way:

Click on your Content Modifier step, previously named Set Extraction Filters and click on Externalize from its properties section.

Create your parameters one by one (use the Add button to allow entering more parameters).

  • Type the parameter name in the Name column from the below table:

Non exhaustive list of available global parameters

Parameter Name

Description

FileName

Name of the generated file passed to IBP that you can download from the Data Integration Jobs app.

TypeOfData

The type of data to load, KeyFigures or MasterData (respect this way of writing).

TimeDisaggregationLevel

Use time level values that are defined in the time profile of the planning area in IBP using the Planning Areas – Model Configuration app.

You can only specify a TimeDisaggregationLevel value that is the same or higher than the base time profile level of the planning level you’re uploading data to. If TimeDisaggregationLevel is left empty, it defaults to the base time profile level.

MasterDataType

The target Master Data type you want to load in IBP without the prefix that is usually used to distinguish master data types for different planning areas.

Example: your master data type is ABCPRODUCT, type in PRODUCT here.

MasterDataPrefix

Here you can set the prefix only.

Example: your master data type is ABCPRODUCT, type in ABC here.

BatchName

The name that appears as batch in the Data Integration Jobs app in IBP.

PostFetchFilterExtensionID

If you are using an extension for defining filters, this is where you’d set its ID. Will be covered in a future blog entry.

ERPMaxPackageSize

Maximum package size coming from the S/4HANA integration addon for IBP.

MappingExtensionID

If you are using an extension for mapping, this is where you’d set its ID. Will be covered in a future blog entry.

Extractor

The S/4HANA extractor ID to use as data source.

ERPRequestedFields

Source fields to map from S/4HANA side. Add them in any order, separated by commas.

Example : PRDID,LOCID,KEYFIGUREDATE,PLANNINGRELEVQTY

IBPFieldList

Target fields to map to IBP. Add them in any order, separated by commas.

Example : PRDID,LOCID,KEYFIGUREDATE,MINRECEIPT

FieldMap

Mapping between above S/4HANA and IBP fields.

Separate mapping groups by commas and separate source from target with colons.

Example : PRDID: PRDID,LOCID: LOCID, KEYFIGUREDATE: KEYFIGUREDATE,PLANNINGRELEVQTY:MINRECEIPT

Note: when both source and target have the same ID, you do not need to add them here, so the simplified version of the mapping in the above case that would also work is :

PLANNINGRELEVQTY:MINRECEIPT

DestinationforSAPIBP

The Destination configured in BTP cockpit to represent the IBP tenant you want to use as target for the flow.

PlanningArea

The IBP planning area as target for the flow.

PlanningAreaVersion

The IBP planning area version as target for the flow.

Filters

Defines the filter criteria in restricted OData format:

• Relational operators

These operators are EQ, NE, LT, LE, GT, GE, and LIKE.

• Logical operators

These operators are AND, NOT, OR, (, and ).

• Functions

These functions are STARTSWITH, ENDSWITH, and SUBSTRINGOF.

Separate the conditions by a comma. The objects you filter on are fields from the S/4HANA extractor.

Example: TIMEPROFILEID EQ '2504',TIMEPROFILELEVEL EQ '2',MRPELEMENTTYPE EQ 'BE'

ERPDestination

The Destination configured in BTP cockpit to represent the S/4HANA tenant you want to use as source for the flow.

ProcessUnchangedData

If you want to skip unchanged data, regardless of SAP IBP

global parameter setting for this behavior, set this parameter to false. If you want to process unchanged data, regardless of the SAP IBP global parameter setting, set this parameter to true. If you leave this parameter field empty, the SAP IBP global parameter determines the behavior.

BatchCommand

Defines the operation type. Accepted parameters are:

INSERT_UPDATE, REPLACE, DELETE.

 

  • Leave the Source type as Constant.
  • The Source Value allows you to either
    • give a default value that will not be modifiable when deploying the iflow,
    • give a default value that the user can update upon deployment,
    • set no value and let the user define it during deployment.

 

To set a default value that will not be editable by the user when deploying the iflow, simply fill in the Source Value field with your value.

Example: you want this iflow to always be executed in Insert/update load mode in IBP.

 

To let the user define the value only upon deploying the iflow, fill in the Source Value field with the name of the parameter surrounded by double brackets on each side (format {{FileName}}). Once you validate, this will appear as < Define Value >.

When you validate:


And finally, to set a default value that can be editable when deploying the iflow, proceed as above with the double brackets strategy and then click on the < Define Value> value. This opens a new window where you can set your default value.

Example: you want your iflow to be used for loading Key Figures by default but if a user needs to change this to send Master Data, they can make that change during deployment.

 

In the end, you have set all global parameters that impacts the way the integration is executed, click on OK.

Then Save.

 

The configuration of your customer iflow as a wrapper of an end to end reusable iflow is finished, we can now deploy it!

 

Deploying your customer iflow

So now we have a customer iflow that :

  • Starts when deployed (manually / via schedule)
  • Expects input global parameters to identify systems, extractor name, filters to apply, mapping, etc.
  • Uses a pre configured reusable iflow that opens connections to source and target systems, reads S/4HANA data, loads data in IBP and triggers post processing there.

To deploy your customer iflow, access it from your package, click on the menu and select Configure to set your final parameters and deploy.

If you Deploy without the configuration, the iflow will use all your defaulted global parameter values directly.

You can here adapt your global parameters if needed, then click on Deploy

Validate the runtime profile as CI by clicking on Yes.

Check the log in the Monitor section of the left side panel. Go to Monitor Message Processing app.

Find your iflow name and select the associated entry

 

Note that in CI you will get individual log entries for each iflow and embedded iflow. This means since we are using a wrapper iflow that calls upon a reusable iflow, itself calling upon individual reusable iflows, you will get multiple entries for your single deployment action.

To identify all logs related to your deployment, you can use the Correlation ID associated to the initial entry associated to your customer iflow entry. Click on the hyperlink, this will copy this value to the header filter and only show you log entries related to your deployment action. You can appreciate all steps executed during this deployment.

Note : when analyzing log issues (will be handled via an example in another blog entry), always start from the last log entry and make your way upwards one by one.

 

Finally, once you’ve checked your flow was successful, you can proceed to the target system, IBP, to confirm post processing. Access the Data Integration Jobs app from your IBP tenant and check logs.

 

That’s it ! you’ve created and executed your first customer iflow in CI from S/4HANA to IBP !

 

Creating customer iflows per IBP object

Now that you’ve successfully created a reference iflow, you can duplicate it as many times as needed and only make changes to the global parameters in order to create integration for all the necessary IBP objects for both key figures (purchase orders, production orders, sales orders & deliveries, actuals, stock,…) and master data (products, locations, PDS, etc.) that are supported by the S/4HANA integration addon for IBP.

You can select your primary customer iflow from the Design section and from its menu, select Copy

 

Give a name to your new iflows identifying what data they are integrating.

For each, access the menu and select Configure. Replace mappings, filters, extractor names, etc. to adjust to the data needed.

Example for the Production Orders iflow:

Click on Save. Do this for each iflow to set up your whole interfaces from S/4HANA to IBP and schedule them accordingly at a later stage as shown previously.

 

You can also copy this iflow to use for master data transfer. Make sure in that case that aside from updating the extractor name, mappings, filters, you also set the TypeOfData parameter to ‘MasterData’ and that you properly fill out the MasterDataType and MasterDataPrefix parameters.
